intro: Sarcocephalus sambucinus, commonly known as the African elderberry, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, thorny stems and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers followed by small, dark purple berries. It is often found in rocky or wooded areas and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional medicinal uses in some African cultures.
